title.narrative: ACCESS TO QUALITY EDUCATION

description.narrative: Eritrean Girls and boys in the most disadvantaged zobas have increased access to quality, inclusive basic education, including in emergencies, which contributes to Early Learning, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, Eritrean girls and boys in four Zobas have access to quality Basic Education and Child Protection Services

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Eritrean Girls and boys in the most disadvantaged zobas have increased access to quality, inclusive basic education, including inemergencies

description.narrative: With UNICEf support a total of 4,267 overaged out-of-school children (2,134 girls) and 110 pre-school age children (30 girls) were enrolled in newly established and existing Complementary Elementary Education (CEE) centres in nomadic and semi-nomadic communities of Gash Barka Region and at existing primary schools in Southern Red Sea Region. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:22/12/2021
